techmeme.title: Nineteen US states have bills to invest public money in crypto, many focus on retirement funds; MI, WI already have crypto in public employees' retirement funds (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)
An Alabama man pleads guilty in connection with the Jan. 2024 SIM-swap hack of the SEC's X account, then used to falsely claim the SEC had approved bitcoin ETFs (Dan Mangan/CNBC)
Google brings NotebookLM Plus, its note-taking AI assistant with higher usage limits, to individuals on Google One AI Premium, and debuts a 50% student discount (Jagmeet Singh/TechCrunch)
Paris AI summit takeaways: Europe has regulation regrets, AI doomsayers have lost ground, and policymakers can't seem to grasp how soon powerful AI could arrive (Kevin Roose/New York Times)
Investors led by Elon Musk make an unsolicited $97.4B bid to buy the nonprofit that controls OpenAI, complicating Sam Altman's plans to convert to a for-profit (Wall Street Journal)
